Scale spatial locations

Source: R/methods-rescale.R
dot-scale_spatial_locations.Rd

Simple scaling of spatial locations by given scale_factor. Values will be scaled from the coordinate origin or coordinates provided through scenter param. Default values supply values for z axis, but these values will only be applied if input data.table has z information as detected by the third item in the geom param.

Usage

.scale_spatial_locations(
  spatlocs,
  scale_factor = c(1, 1, 1),
  scenter = c(0, 0, 0),
  geom = c("sdimx", "sdimy", "sdimz")
)

Arguments

spatlocs

data.table. spatial locations information to scale

scale_factor

scaling factor to apply to coordinates. Default is c(1, 1, 1)

scenter

center from which to scale spatial coordinates. Given as vector of xy(z) coordinates. Default is c(0, 0, 0)

geom

character. Named vector of colnames of x, y, (z) coordinate columns. Default is c("sdimx", "sdimy", "sdimz")

Value

spatial locations

Details

scale_factor either given as a single value where it will be applied to x, y, and z (if available) dimensions or as a vector of named values for 'x', y', (and 'z').

On this page
